member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.GetDataFramesFromMapServerObject(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the names of dataframes from a map server object.
member.returns: An array of dataframe names as strings
member.remarks: An ArcGIS Server map service is based on a map document (usually an .mxd file) that can contain multiple data frames, each with separate sets of layers and symbology. This method retrieves a list of these data frames.
member.param: The map server object's name.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.GetDataFramesFromMapServerObject(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the dataframes from a map server object
member.param: The map server object's name.
If true and only one data frame is in the map, returns "(default)".
member.returns: An array list of map server object names as strings

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.GetDataFramesFromMapServerObject(ESRI.ArcGIS.Carto.IMapServer)
member.summary: Gets the dataframes from a map server object
member.returns: An array of data frame names as strings.
member.remarks: An ArcGIS Server map service is based on a map document (usually an .mxd file) that can contain multiple data frames, each with separate sets of layers and symbology. This method retrieves a list of these data frames.
member.param: The map server object.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.AGS.AGSServerConnection.GetDataFramesFromMapServerObject(ESRI.ArcGIS.Carto.IMapServer,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the dataframes from a map server object
member.param: The map server object.
If true and only one data frame is in the map, returns "(default)".
member.returns: An array list of map server object names as strings

member.summary: Indicates whether the specified server object is a map server.
member.param: The name of the server object.
member.returns: True if server object is a map server. False if it is not.
member.remarks: Please note that a service name can be shared by more than one type of server. For example, a GP service and a map service can be named the same.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.TCPConnection
member.summary: Class used to send requests and responses via TCP to an ArcIMS Application Server.

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.IMSServerConnection
member.summary: Abstract class for common functionality of a connection to an ArcIMS server.

remarks.para:
An IMS server connection is used to communicate with an ArcIMS server without going through a
Map control or other ESRI Web ADF controls. Use one of the derived classes to actually create a connection:

list.item: TCPConnection - for connecting over a local network using a TCP/IP connection.
HTTPConnection - for connecting over the Internet using an HTTP connection.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.IMSServerConnection.Send(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a request to the specified service.
member.param: A valid ArcXML request.
member.returns: ArcXML response from the ArcIMS Application Server.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.IMSServerConnection.Send(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a request to the specified service using a custom service.
member.returns: ArcXML response from the ArcIMS Application Server.
member.param: A valid ArcXML request.
The custom service (Query, Geocode, Extract) associated with the specified service name.

member.summary: Convenience method to retrieve an ArrayList of services associated with an ArcIMS site.
member.returns: of service names.

member.summary: Convenience method to retrieve an ArrayList of services associated with an ArcIMS site.
member.returns: of services.
member.param: Specify the Services based on this ServerType[] value (e.g. ImageServer)
Set true to ignore the case of filterType string, false otherwise (default: True)

member.summary: Constructs a TCPConnection object.

member.summary: Constructs a TCPConnection object.

Port at which the ArcIMS App Server is hosted.
member.exception: Connect has failed. The InnerException property gives access to the exception that triggered this one.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.TCPConnection.Finalize
member.summary: Destructor. Closes connection to ArcIMS Application Server if connected.
member.remarks: The InnerException property gives access to the exception that triggered this one.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.TCPConnection.IsAlive
member.summary: Check to see if there is a valid connection to the ArcIMS server.
member.returns: Boolean value corresponding to whether there is a valid connection to the ArcIMS server.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.TCPConnection.Send(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a request.
member.param: Request to send.
member.returns: Response received.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.TCPConnection.Send(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a request.
member.param: Request to send.
Custom service to send request to.
member.returns: Response from the service.
member.remarks:
If service not found, return string is error message sent by server in format: "Error: Requested Service is not available."
If request is not valid, return string is error in format: "<ERROR>Invalid catalog function.</ERROR>"

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.ConnectionMode
member.summary: ConnectionMode is implemented within the ADF to allow the web application to respond to backup/recovery situations with the server. The ConnectionMode is used to define the type of failover to perform.

member.summary: Does not perform any type of backup/recovery

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.ConnectionMode.Failover
member.summary: Reroute all requests to the alternate connection entry

member.name: F:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.ConnectionMode.RoundRobin

member.name: T:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.HTTPConnection
member.summary: Class used to send requests and responses via HTTP to an ArcIMS server.
member.remarks: This type of server connection uses an HTTP connection to communicate with the ArcIMS server. Since it uses standard HTTP port (usually 80), it can communicate over the Internet. It communicates via the ArcIMS Servlet Connector. Therefore the ArcIMS Servlet Connector must be available on the remote server and must be communicating to its ArcIMS Application Server in order to send requests.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.HTTPConnection.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new HTTPConnection object.
member.param: URI of the ArcIMS server. May include the scheme (http or https) and a port (e.g., 80 or 8080).

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.HTTPConnection.Send(System.String)
member.summary: Sends an ArcXML request to the server.
member.returns: The ArcXML response.
member.param: The ArcXML request to send.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.HTTPConnection.Send(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends an ArcXML request to the server.
member.returns: The ArcXML response.
member.param: The ArcXML request to send.
The custom service (Query, Geocode, Extract) to send the request to.

member.name: M:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.HTTPConnection.IsAlive
member.summary: Check to see if there is a valid connection to the ArcIMS server.
member.returns: Boolean value corresponding to whether there is a valid connection to the ArcIMS server.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.HTTPConnection.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP port for the server.
member.remarks: Default is 80, the standard HTTP port.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.HTTPConnection.User
member.summary: Gets or sets the username associated with the user accessing the URI.
member.remarks: Only required if the ArcIMS server is configured to require credentials for the service being requested. The username and password are those set for the Servlet Connector at the remote ArcIMS server.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.HTTPConnection.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password associated with the user accessing the URI.
member.remarks: Only required if the ArcIMS server is configured to require credentials for the service being requested. The username and password are those set for the Servlet Connector at the remote ArcIMS server.

member.summary: Gets or sets the timeout associated with the HttpWebRequest object.

member.name: P:ESRI.ArcGIS.ADF.Connection.IMS.HTTPConnection.Path
member.summary: Gets or sets the path associated with the HttpWebRequest object.
